;Eight years later, we spent the most beautiful time in Geleshan, the suburb of Chongqing, the capital of Chongqing, where azaleas bloomed all over the hills and pine trees danced in the wind. time. From 1938 to 1941, my father served as the Charge d’Affaires of the Republic of China in Italy for four years. When World War II broke out and China and Italy broke off diplomatic relations, my parents took my sister Xiaoyu and me back to China. Grandma also came to Geleshan from her aunt's house in Chengdu to welcome her third son after four years of separation.

;

;Our plane landed in Chongqing, and the welcome crowd gathered next to our parents, speaking adult Chinese. I walked down the gangway and stepped onto the land of China. I was extremely moved. This is my motherland! My eight-year-old heart nearly burst. My elementary school classmates in Rome once asked me, Uncle! (This is the pronunciation of Xu Xiaohu by foreigners)

;

;;Uncle Stop shouting! Why is your face so flat? ;

;

;I thought about it and answered: This is because I come from a very far away and very ancient country. The Chinese Embassy you saw on Viale Pola has strong guards in front of it wearing beautiful uniforms and tall feathered helmets. That is my ancient and luxurious motherland.

;

;Now I kneel on the land of my motherland, bend down and lower my head, passionately kiss the place I have dreamed of for four years, I am happy and moved, and shed tears. Tell the motherland softly, great land, the tiger cub is back, your child is back. I will learn Chinese as soon as possible and become a Chinese.

;

;The land at that time was so dirty, not as bright and clean as Rome. I saw dirty children with tattered clothes and scabs on their heads, standing there with bare feet and a runny nose, staring at us. Like adults, they spit out phlegm from their mouths and spit it on the ground. Xiaohu was very sad when he returned to China, but he insisted on thinking that this is my favorite motherland, that far, far away, very ancient motherland.

;

;After several hours of climbing up the hillside in a sedan chair, we finally arrived at the small, dark mud house at No. 15, Bakuaitian, Geleshan. Someone was carrying the luggage in, and my mother and sister went into the house and rummaged through the luggage for something. I stayed on the balcony and watched my father kneel down next to my grandmother who had her head and feet bound. Mother and son hugged each other, and grandma burst into tears, her thin and high-pitched voice reaching to the sky. Dad cried silently, and they held him and cried like this for a long time. I felt sad after reading it. I didn’t understand a word, but I fully understood the emotion in their hearts. I left quietly, walked into the door, climbed on a chair next to the big round table, and saw a pot of tea and a few unattended cups on the table. Don’t know what that drink is, but it must be a drink from my home country. I just poured myself a drink and watched.

;

;Bitter. Adult taste. taste of China. I love it, I want to love it. Have another drink and taste it. Another glass. I have never tasted this taste in my life. A flavor not found in Italy. I am Chinese and I can drink Chinese taste. Cup after cup, I took in this ancient flavor with love and breathed it into my soul. Xu Xiaohu and her motherland gradually became one.

;

;It is starting to get dark. The crying and complaining outside hasn't stopped yet, but it's hard to see clearly inside the house. Someone placed a lamp on the big table. It was a green long-handled oil lamp made of ceramics. There was a white wick floating on the bowl of oil, and it was burning with its head exposed on one side, emitting very little light. Is this the only lighting in our entire large room (dining room)? The newly returned Chinese found that she could not see anything, and it was nothing like the light of a Roman electric chandelier. She suddenly felt very ashamed. This is the ancient lighting of my motherland. No matter how bright it is, I will still love it.

;

;I don’t remember how I fell asleep on the first night in Geleshan. I just remember that I insisted on going to school right away, learning my mother tongue again, and becoming a Chinese primary school students. I didn't expect that I was sent to the first grade to learn how to speak Chinese when I expected to continue studying in the fourth grade of elementary school. I went to school happily. I still remember the first class saying "Come, come, come to school, everyone come to school." All Chinese characters did not have any phonetic symbols - we went directly to understand the ancient Chinese characters. On the way home, my classmates chased me and threw stones, shouting "foreign woman!"

;

;My hair is not black and straight. It is brown and curved. When I got home, I scrubbed hard with water and a brush, trying to get it straight and black. No matter how wet it is or how you brush it, it will curl up again as soon as it dries. I had no choice but to face these classmates myself, fight with them, and beat them to the ground one by one. After all, I am already eight years old, a little taller than my first grade classmates. Xiaohu, who never behaved negatively when getting along with his Italian classmates, began to release an inner energy and felt very proud. It turns out that the children of the motherland during the war used physical strength to persuade each other. Well, start learning to speak Chinese and start becoming a Chinese hero.

;At that time, I already spoke Chinese well. That perspective allowed me to interact with adults from a wonderful distance. The world is separated by a buffer zone.

;On those generous branches, everything loses the persuasiveness of "adults say". From an arboreal perspective, everything happening on the ground becomes less urgent and threatening. Observing them from a higher perspective than adults reveals that adults often undermine the bounds of worldly wisdom or common sense. Surprisingly, they are often like this, spending a lot of time engaging in unnecessary words and deeds; making many unnecessary actions, untrue behaviors, and developing a hypocritical mentality.
